poem:
Al Max Fishermen  

In Alexandria's breath, they toil,  
Men of sea, in sardine dance,  
Net cast wide in morning's foil,  
Stories caught in sunrise glance.  
Ahmad's lens, from rooftop high,  
Frames the humble, fleeting sigh,  
Of life afloat on water's chore,  
May it linger, evermore.
